ELISHA MITCHELL, HER MOTHER LOIS AND GRANDMOTHER BERTHA ARE LOOKING FOR A NEW HOME.
AFTER FIVE YEARS IN THE SUBURBS, THE FAMILY HAS DECIDED TO MOVE BACK TO THE CITY TO BE CLOSER TO JOBS, FRIENDS AND FAMILY.
THE CHALLENGE IS FINDING A HOME THAT SUITS THREE VERY DISTINCTIVE TASTES.
CAN THESE THREE GENERATIONS FIND ONE HOUSE THAT'S A PERFECT FIT FOR EACH OF THEM?

TO SHORTEN THEIR COMMUTE, ELISHA MITCHELL, HER MOTHER LOIS AND HER GRANDMOTHER BERTHA ARE MOVING BACK INTO THE CITY FROM THE SUBURBS.
BUT FINDING A HOME TO SUIT EACH MEMBER OF THIS THREE-GENERATION FAMILY WON'T BE EASY.
HELPING THEM FIND THIS ONE PERFECT HOME IS VETERAN REALTOR JEANETTE WILLIAMS.

MEG AND BRIAN PUCCINELLI ARE LOOKING FOR A HOME IN WHICH TO RAISE THEIR YOUNG CHILDREN.

HELLO... WELCOME HOUSE
HUNTERS. I'M SUZANNE
WHANG. PHILLIP AND DIANE RAMMON ARE AMERICANS WHO HAVE BEEN LIVING OVERSEAS FOR THE PAST 20
YEARS. NOW THEY'RE RETURNING TO THE STATES WITH THEIR YOUNGEST DAUGHTER TO BE CLOSER TO THEIR TWO ADULT CHILDREN WHO LIVE IN
CALIFORNIA. BUT THIS FAMILY'S HOMECOMING WON'T BE
EFFORTLESS. HOME PRICES HAVE RISEN DRASTICALLY SINCE THEY'VE BEEN
AWAY. SUFFERING FROM STICKER SHOCK AS WELL AS CULTURE SHOCK, THE RAMMONS ENTER THE HOUSING MARKET NEXT ON HOUSE
HUNTERS.   (Suzanne) PHILLIP AND DIANE RAMMON ARE BOTH PROFESSIONAL VIOLINISTS WHO HAVE DEVOTED THEIR LIVES TO PLAYING AND TEACHING
MUSIC. SO 23 YEARS AGO WHEN THEY WERE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO PLAY WITH AN ORCHESTRA IN GERMANY, IT WAS AN OFFER THEY COULDN'T
REFUSE. SO WE PICKED UP WITH A 1 -YEAR-OLD AND A 4 -YEAR-OLD AND TOOK OFF
AND... THINKING THAT WE'D COME HOME AT ANYTIME, BUT THEN WE FOUND OURSELVES MORE SETTLED AND MORE SETTLED, SO WE BOUGHT A HOUSE ALMOST 14 YEARS AGO, AND WE'VE BEEN THERE FOR 23
YEARS. AND NOW AS THINGS DO IN LIFE, WE PLAY A FULL CIRCLE, AND WE'RE DECIDING TO COME
HOME. (Suzanne) ALONG WITH THEIR YOUNGEST DAUGHTER, BELLA, THE RAMMONS HAVE RETURNED TO
AMERICA. THE COUPLE'S TWO GROWN CHILDREN, NORISSA AND ANDREW, MOVED BACK TO THE UNITED STATES SEVERAL YEARS
AGO. RELOCATING WOULD BRING THE FAMILY CLOSER TOGETHER, BUT IT WOULD ALSO MEAN GIVING UP THEIR HOME IN GERMANY AND THE COMFORTABLE AND SETTLED LIFESTYLE THAT WENT WITH
IT. WE'RE NOT FAMILIAR WITH THIS AREA,

TOO. WE'RE TAKING THE TIME TO LOOK AROUND AND SEE WHAT POSSIBILITIES THERE ARE FOR OUR WORK AND WHERE IT'S NICE TO LIVE AND WHERE THE SHOPPING AND WHERE ALL THE SCHOOLS FACILITIES ARE AND EVERYTHING, A GENERAL

SITUATION. WE'RE BASICALLY JUMPING OFF THE DEEP END HERE, BUT IF YOU'RE DETERMINED IN YOUR HEART THAT THAT'S WHAT YOU WANT TO DO, I THINK, THAT MAKES UP FOR MAYBE A LOSS OF CERTAIN AMENITIES THAT YOU HAVE IN YOUR
HOME. A HOME IS BURSTING AFTER A CERTAIN POINT WITH PILLOWS AND BLANKETS AND EXTRA BEDS AND EXTRA PLATES AND A LOT OF THINGS THAT WE'LL PROBABLY NOT HAVE FOR A LONG TIME
HERE. BUT THAT'S ALL
RIGHT... THAT'S ALL
RIGHT. WE
HAVE... WE HAVE OTHER THINGS HERE THAT MAKE US
HAPPY. (Suzanne) ALTHOUGH THEY'RE HAPPY TO BE CLOSER TO THEIR CHILDREN, THE RAMMONS ARE FEELING CRAMPED IN THE SMALL TEMPORARY APARTMENT THEY'RE RENTING UNTIL THEY CAN FIND A
HOUSE. (Diane) OKAY, BELLA DONNA, GETTING READY TO BED DOWN FOR THE
NIGHT? OUR YOUNGEST DAUGHTER SLEEPS ON THE COUCH, SOMETIMES AN AIR MATTRESS, AND WE WOULD LIKE VERY MUCH FOR BELLA TO HAVE HER OWN
ROOM. I THINK THAT THAT WOULD ONLY BE
RIGHT. AND GOOD NIGHT TO
YOU... GOOD
NIGHT. (Suzanne) HIGH ON THEIR LIST OF PRIORITIES IS FINDING A HOME WITH THREE BEDROOMS AND AT LEAST TWO
BATHROOMS. ONE BATHROOM IS A LITTLE DIFFICULT, IF YOU HAVE MORE THAN TWO WOMEN IN ONE PLACE, OR ONE
WOMAN. IT GETS TO BE VERY
DIFFICULT. WE RECENTLY HAD SOME GERMAN FRIENDS VISIT US, AND THAT WAS AMUSING, TOO, ABOUT HOW MANY PEOPLE YOU CAN STUFF INTO A ONE-BEDROOM
APARTMENT. (Suzanne) DESPITE THE LACK OF SPACE, THERE ARE SOME FEATURES OF THEIR APARTMENT THE RAMMONS
ENJOY. WHAT I LIKE ABOUT THE KITCHEN IS THE CUPBOARD SPACE, AND IT'S BASICALLY EVERYTHING YOU NEED NOW, DISHWASHER, REFRIGERATOR AND
OVEN... THAT'S
IT. WHAT ELSE DO YOU
NEED? (Suzanne) AS A MATTER OF PRINCIPLE, THE RAMMONS WOULD ALSO RATHER OWN THAN
RENT. BUT WANTING TO INVEST IN BUYING A HOME AND ACTUALLY DOING IT ARE TWO DIFFERENT
THINGS. BECAUSE THE RAMMONS ARE SELF-EMPLOYED AND LACK A LONG CREDIT HISTORY IN THE
U.S., THEY WILL HAVE SOME OBSTACLES TO OVERCOME BEFORE THEIR DREAM OF HOMEOWNERSHIP WILL BE ANYTHING MORE THAN JUST THAT--A
DREAM. WELL, WE HAVE, CERTAINLY, THINGS TO THINK
ABOUT. I DON'T KNOW WHETHER YOU'D CALL THEM FEARS, BUT WHETHER WE CAN AFFORD THE
HOUSE. WE WENT TO ABOUT THREE OR FOUR LOAN COMPANIES, BANKS, AND THEY SAID, OH, NO
WAY! EVEN A REAL ESTATE AGENT THAT WE WENT TO FIRST OF ALL-- HE SAID, OH, YOU CAN'T DO ANYTHING

SINCE GETTING MARRIED 11 YEARS AGO, MARK AND WENDY COHEN HAVE BEEN BUSY FULFILLING CHERISHED DREAMS LIKE RAISING A FAMILY.

FOR MUCH OF THAT TIME THEY NEEDED THE FINANCIAL FLEXIBILITY OF RENTING, BUT THEIR TWO YOUNG DAUGHTERS ARE GROWING OLDER, AND THE FAMILY IS LOOKING TO PUT DOWN MORE PERMANENT ROOTS BY BUYING A HOUSE OF THEIR VERY OWN.
JOIN US AS WE FOLLOW WENDY AND MARK ON THEIR HUNT FOR THAT LONG-AWAITED HOUSE.

OUR INTENTIONS HAVE ALWAYS BEEN TO FIND A HOUSE TO MOVE INTO, TO RAISE A FAMILY IN.

HOUSE HUNTERS...
I'M SUZANNE WHANG.
HIGH SCHOOL TEACHERS SCOTT MAXSON AND MARY CALLUZA ARE ENGAGED TO BE MARRIED.
THEY EACH CURRENTLY OWN THEIR OWN HOME, BUT WITH THEIR WEDDING DAY JUST A FEW WEEKS AWAY, THEIR LIFESTYLES ARE ABOUT TO CHANGE.
IN FACT, THEIR FIRST MOVE TOGETHER AS HUSBAND AND WIFE WILL BE TO BUY A NEW HOUSE...
WOW! TUNED AND WATCH THESE TEACHERS LEARN THE FUNDAMENTALS OF HOME BUYING.
SCOTT MAXSON, HIS FIANCE MARY CALLUZA AND HER DAUGHTER KORIN ARE ABOUT TO MAKE SOME CHANGES IN THEIR LIVES.
NOT ONLY ARE SCOTT AND MARY ABOUT TO WALK DOWN THE AISLE TOGETHER, BUT THEY WILL ALSO BE TAKING THEIR FIRST BIG STEP AS A MARRIED COUPLE-- BUYING A HOUSE.
WE WANNA SELL BOTH OF OUR PLACES AND BUY A BIGGER HOUSE THAT'LL BE NICER, BIGGER, A PLACE WHERE KORIN CAN HAVE A GOOD PLACE TO LIVE, AND WE CAN ENJOY THAT BIGGER, NICER SPACE.
WHERE I'VE BEEN LIVING IS A ONE-BEDROOM HOUSE, WHICH IS A LITTLE BIT RARE, BUT I WAS ABLE TO AFFORD IT.
THE HOUSE HAS SOME PROBLEMS...
IT'S AN OLD HOUSE.
A LOT OF THE OLDER HOUSES...
OLD- FASHIONED DOORWAYS.
I'M SIX, FIVE...
WITH MY SHOES ON, I'M SIX, SIX.
THE DOORWAYS ARE SOMETIMES ONLY ABOUT SIX, THREE OR FOUR.
THE NEIGHBORHOOD IS...
I'M ON THE EDGE OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD WHERE IT'S NOT AS SAFE.
THE AIR DOESN'T FEEL GREAT FOR A FAMILY.
(Suzanne) THE FEATURE THAT SCOTT ENJOYS MOST ABOUT HIS HOUSE IS THE LARGE GARAGE THAT IS ATTACHED TO HIS LIVING ROOM.
SCOTT, WHO IS A MUSIC TEACHER, CONVERTED THE ENTIRE SPACE INTO A COMPLETE MUSIC STUDIO WHERE HE SPENDS MUCH OF HIS TIME REHEARSING AND RECORDING ORIGINAL SONGS.
AN ADDED BONUS IS THAT SCOTT DOESN'T HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT DISTURBING ANY NEIGHBORS.
WHAT I LIKE ABOUT THE CURRENT HOUSE I'M IN IS THAT THERE'S NOT TOO MANY NEIGHBORS AROUND IT OR NOT TOO MANY PEOPLE LIVING CLOSE TO THE MUSIC STUDIO PART OF THE HOUSE.
ONE THING I HATE ARE HIGH-DENSITY NEIGHBORHOODS WHERE MANY NEIGHBORS CAN HEAR THE MUSIC I PLAY, THE DRUMS, THE MARIMBA, THE VIBES AND THE ELECTRONIC MUSIC KEYBOARDS.
I'VE BEEN USED TO HAVING A GARAGE I CONVERTED TO A MUSIC KIND OF RECORDING, REHEARSAL TYPE ROOM.
AND WE HOPE TO FIND A PLACE THAT CAN ACCOMMODATE THAT AND HAVE A GARAGE WHERE I CAN DO THAT.
(Suzanne) WHILE SCOTT'S HOUSE WAS SUITABLE FOR ONE PERSON, IT'S NOT AN IDEAL SITUATION FOR A FAMILY OF THREE.

SCOTT'S FIANCE MARY WOULD LIKE TO FIND A HOUSE WHERE SHE FEELS AS SAFE AND COMFORTABLE AS SHE DOES IN HER CURRENT TWO-BEDROOM CONDOMINIUM, A PLACE THAT SHE AND HER DAUGHTER KORIN HAVE CALLED HOME FOR THREE YEARS.

I LIKE THE FACT THAT IT'S A SECURE BUILDING AND THAT I'M ON THE SECOND FLOOR IN THE REAR OF THE BUILDING, AND IT'S VERY QUIET, BUT I DO HAVE SOMEBODY WHO LIVES UNDERNEATH ME AND SOMEONE ABOVE ME, AND SO YOU DO HEAR NOISE FROM THE OTHER TENANTS.
AND THIS IS A PERFECT SPOT IN TERMS OF LOCATION FOR ME TO GET TO WORK AND TO GET TO MY DAUGHTER KORIN'S SCHOOL, BUT IT REALLY ISN'T BIG ENOUGH FOR A FAMILY.
AND BECAUSE IT'S A CONDO AND THERE ARE NEIGHBORS, IT ISN'T SUITABLE TO HAVE A MUSIC STUDIO.

IT WOULD BE IDEAL FOR ME, IF WE COULD FIND A TWO-STORY HOUSE.

AFTER NEARLY TWO YEARS OF MARRIAGE, AMY AND MARK BRADFORD ARE READY TO BECOME HOMEOWNERS.
CURRENTLY APARTMENT DWELLERS, THIS YOUNG COUPLE IS LOOKING FORWARD TO LIVING IN A HOME OF THEIR OWN.
BUT THEY'RE HAVING TROUBLE FINDING ONE THEY CAN AFFORD IN A NEIGHBORHOOD THEY LIKE.
WILL THE BRADFORDS FIND A HOME WITHOUT COMPROMISING THEIR DREAM?
FIND OUT NEXT ON HOUSE HUNTERS.

I'M SUZANNE WHANG.
EVER SINCE DR.
MIMI GREENBERG RETIRED, SHE HAS PUT HER ENERGY INTO FULFILLING LIFETIME DREAMS.
SO FAR, THIS HAS MEANT TRAVELING ALL OVER THE WORLD.
BUT MIMI HAS ANOTHER DREAM, AND THAT ONE IS TO LIVE EVERY DAY WITH AN OCEAN VIEW OF HER OWN.
JOIN US AS MIMI SEARCHES FOR A HOME THAT WILL GIVE HER THE VIEW SHE LONGS FOR...
NEXT ON HOUSE HUNTERS.
MIMI GREENBERG WORKED FOR MANY YEARS AS A PSYCHOLOGIST IN PRIVATE PRACTICE.
HER CAREER LEFT LITTLE TIME FOR HOBBIES LIKE GARDENING AND TRAVEL.
BUT MIMI HAS BEEN MAKING UP FOR IT EVER SINCE HER EARLY RETIREMENT A FEW YEARS AGO.
NOW SHE SPENDS ALMOST HALF HER TIME TRAVELING.
(Mimi) I'VE BEEN TO FRANCE QUITE A FEW TIMES, UM, BUT I LIKE COUNTRIES WHERE THERE'S GREAT FOOD, UM, ART, AND UM, JUST A GENERAL APPRECIATION FOR THE FINE ARTS.
(Suzanne) WHEN SHE'S NOT ON THE ROAD, MIMI LIVES IN A HIGH-RISE URBAN CONDOMINIUM.
SHE SHARES HER HOME WITH ONE CAT NAMED CAPPUCCINO AND ANOTHER ONE NAMED LATTE.
THE CONDO IS FULL OF ANTIQUES, BUT MIMI DIDN'T GET THEM ON HER TRAVELS.
AS MUCH AS SHE LOVES BEAUTIFUL THINGS, HER TRIPS ARE MEANT TO BE ADVENTURES, NOT SHOPPING EXPEDITIONS.
(Mimi) THE FURNISHINGS IN MY HOME HAVE ALMOST NOTHING TO DO WITH MY TRAVELS.
WHAT I BRING BACK FROM MY TRAVELS ARE EDIBLES.
HA-HA! THIS HAPPY WANDERER DOESN'T PLAN TO STOP TRAVELING ANYTIME SOON.
BUT MIMI IS FACING A CHALLENGE THAT IMPACTS JUST ABOUT EVERY ASPECT OF HER LIFE.
MIMI HAS MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS, A DISORDER THAT AFFECTS BOTH HER BALANCE AND HER MOBILITY.
IT IS SOMETHING THAT MIMI MUST TAKE INTO CONSIDERATION WHETHER AT HOME OR ABROAD.
SHE HAS MODIFIED HER CURRENT CONDOMINIUM IN WAYS THAT MAKE GETTING AROUND EASIER.
FOR INSTANCE, THIS HANDICAP-ACCESSIBLE BATHROOM WAS ONCE A CLOSET AND A HALF BATH.
THE MODIFICATIONS MIMI HAS MADE TO HER CONDO MAKE IT A COMFORTABLE PLACE TO CALL HOME.
BUT IRONICALLY, HER HOME'S BEST FEATURE IS ALSO THE ONE SHE WANTS TO CHANGE.
(Mimi) WHAT I LIKE MOST ABOUT THE SPACE THAT I'M IN IS THERE'S A FABULOUS VIEW OF THE HILLS.
AND EVEN THOUGH I DON'T GO OUTSIDE, UM, MANY DAYS, AT LEAST I FEEL LIKE I'M OUT THERE WITH THE VIEW.
(Suzanne) AS MUCH AS MIMI ENJOYS SEEING MOUNTAINS, SHE HAS ALWAYS DREAMED OF LIVING NEAR THE OCEAN, AND NOW WANTS TO EXPLORE THE POSSIBILITY OF REPLACING THIS VIEW WITH ONE OF CRASHING SURF.
BUT FOR MIMI, FINDING A NEW PLACE TO LIVE ISN'T AS SIMPLE AS FINDING THE PERFECT OCEAN VIEW.
BECAUSE OF HER DISABILITY, SHE NEEDS A CONDO THAT IS FREE OF STAIRS, WITH HALLWAYS WIDE ENOUGH FOR HER SCOOTER.
SHE ALSO NEEDS A LITTLE ASSISTANCE FROM TIME TO TIME.
LIVING IN A FULL-SERVICE BUILDING NEAR A BUSINESS DISTRICT IS ALL-IMPORTANT, BECAUSE IT ENABLES MIMI TO STAY INDEPENDENT.
(Mimi) I CAN TAKE MY SCOOTER AND SCOOT TO THE SUPERMARKET, TO THE MOVIES, TO VIRTUALLY ANYTHING THAT I MIGHT WANT TO DO.
SO I CAN BE INDEPENDENT AND TAKE CARE OF MYSELF AND MY NEEDS.
(Suzanne) IF MIMI MOVES, IT MUST BE TO A BUILDING THAT'S CLOSE TO A COMMERCIAL AREA AND TO A PLACE THAT IS OR CAN BE MADE DISABILITY FRIENDLY.
(Mimi) I WOULD LOVE A SPACE THAT SOME OTHER PERSON WHO HAD NEEDS SIMILAR TO MINE BUILT OUT THE SPACE.
THAT'S NOT VERY LIKELY TO HAPPEN.
THEN MY NEXT CHOICE WOULD BE JUST GIVE ME AN EMPTY ROOM, RAW SQUARE FOOTAGE, AND LET ME WORK WITH A CONTRACTOR OR AN ARCHITECT WHO WILL BUILD IT OUT TO MY NEEDS.
(Suzanne) MIMI GREENBERG REALIZES THAT FINDING A PLACE THAT CAN BE ADAPTED TO HER NEEDS AND HAS A FABULOUS OCEAN VIEW WILL BE A CHALLENGE.
BUT SHE FACES CHALLENGES EVERY DAY AND WELCOMES THIS ONE.
LIFE IF FINITE, AND THIS IS AN OPPORTUNITY TO GO AND LIVE AT THE OCEAN.

MIMI GREENBERG HAS SPENT MUCH OF HER RETIREMENT IN SEARCH OF ADVENTURE.
WHEN NOT AT HOME, SHE MIGHT BE SEARCHING FOR A GREAT MEAL IN PARIS OR A SUNNY BEACH ALONG THE COAST OF MEXICO.
BUT MIMI HAS MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS AND MAY SOMEDAY HAVE TO CUT BACK ON HER TRAVELS.
SO SHE'S DECIDED TO LOOK FOR A NEW HOME, ONE THAT WILL COMBINE THE ADVANTAGES OF CITY LIVING WITH A BEAUTIFUL VIEW OF THE SEA.
HELPING HER FIND THAT IS REALTOR GLORIA HICKS, WHO SPECIALIZES IN HOUSING FOR THE PHYSICALLY CHALLENGED AND IS WELL AWARE OF MIMI'S SPECIAL NEEDS.
